China c.bank set to stand pat on medium-term policy rate in FebChina's central bank is expected to stand pat on a key policy rate when rolling over the maturing medium-term loans in just over a week from now, a Reuters survey showed, as the authorities appear to be keen to maintain currency stability. Thu, 08 Feb 2024 05:44:35 GMT GKWOVKUTKJJ7RCVSGGTW53V2QE https://www.reuters.com/world/china/china-cbank-set-stand-pat-medium-term-policy-rate-feb-2024-02-08/Reuters世界中国
Morning Bid: China's deflation worry a bad omen for new yearA look at the day ahead in European and global markets from Tom Westbrook. Thu, 08 Feb 2024 05:34:00 GMT H3OMRG27KFIBPMJT73OGTRL7DE https://www.reuters.com/markets/europe/global-markets-view-europe-2024-02-08/Reuters市场欧洲市场
China stocks extend bounce on regulatory change-of-guardBeaten-up Chinese stocks were set for a fourth day of gain on Thursday after a change of leadership at the market regulator, shoring up expectation of further support measures as China heads into a long Lunar New Year holiday this week. Thu, 08 Feb 2024 03:04:04 GMT BNTWYL75QFLVTOQZYLTT36NLX4 https://www.reuters.com/world/china/china-stocks-extend-bounce-regulatory-change-of-guard-2024-02-08/Rae Wee世界中国
Hillhouse Investment acquires Singapore's InCorp GlobalSingapore-headquartered corporate solutions and business advisory firm InCorp Global said on Thursday it has been acquired by global alternative investment firm Hillhouse Investment. Thu, 08 Feb 2024 02:58:33 GMT 6ISJMMOP6BJLFHVYTRA34BXBHE https://www.reuters.com/markets/deals/hillhouse-investment-acquires-singapores-incorp-global-2024-02-08/Reuters市场交易
Asian shares track Wall Street higher; China deflation risks persistMost Asian markets tracked Wall Street higher on Thursday, but Chinese stocks were battling to sustain a rally after data raised concerns about deflationary pressures in China and suggested the economic slowdown may have further to run. Thu, 08 Feb 2024 02:28:01 GMT 3ARYVRE36RKS5JWUYFTP4VWABA https://www.reuters.com/markets/global-markets-wrapup-1-2024-02-08/Stella Qiu市场
China's consumer prices suffer biggest fall since 2009 as deflation risks stalk economyChina's consumer prices fell at their steepest pace in more than 14 years in January while producer prices also dropped, ramping up pressure on policymakers to do more to revive an economy low on confidence and facing deflationary risks. Thu, 08 Feb 2024 02:18:10 GMT 2YTIS754KRMQHFTE6GJGYCGJ54 https://www.reuters.com/world/china/chinas-consumer-prices-suffer-steepest-fall-since-2009-deflation-risks-stalk-2024-02-08/Qiaoyi Li, Ryan Woo世界中国
